nodes.bodyText:
I would maybe keep this test as the only one that actually uses the patternfly table component and mock in the rest.
The goal is to make the snapshot shorter - this way we make sure that the component renders fine with default props and then in other snapshots just focus on the behavior (often it is emtpy-state vs. table rednered - but we don't need to see the contents of the table, it is enough to see that table component is being used)
here I am still not clear on the description of the test, one is Boolean assertions-false, second Boolean assertions-true - what is the difference?

Hum, the snapshots for the two tests are identical, just differ based on passed values (state COMPLETED vs. PENDING in one process instance). So unless there's some reason I am missing I would remove both the snapshots, cause they're identical also to Snapshot test with default props. If this is due to coverage - we might need to test differently - cause there's nothing interesting in the resulting snapshot.
This is made as one single snapshot tests all state values
is empty-state in snapshot here expected?
@jstastny-cz yes it is, as per the condition provided.
Should zero offset result in empty-state? Or needs the test to be fixed?
This is fixed, now it renders table not empty-state
can we try mocking LoadMore too?
I think we can mock all the icons used here, it'll save some space in snapshots.
